keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after a family tipped authorities that he was planning to shoot up the airport via a social media livestream.
Cagle was seen arriving in a Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal and had an AR-15 assault rifle with 27 rounds of ammunition in his possession.
The arrest was prevented through early warning from family members, who reported that Cagle had livestreamed on social media his intent to 'shoot it up' at the airport.
Cagle is charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
He has a history of mental health struggles, including a stated diagnosis of schizophrenia and prior treatment with medication, and was known to friends like Nick Roberts for years.
The incident highlights the importance of community vigilance, social media monitoring, and the role of law enforcement in preventing mass violence.
Police and federal authorities are investigating how Cagle obtained the firearm, which authorities state he was not legally allowed to possess.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Billy Joe Cagle, a 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after family members alerted authorities that he had livestreamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' at the world’s busiest airport. Police found an AR-15 assault rifle with 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, who has a history of mental health issues including schizophrenia, was taken into custody before carrying out the attack. He has been charged with terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, and possession of firearms by a felon and a felon in the commission of a felony. The incident is credited to early warning from family members and swift police action, with officials praising the community's vigilance and the success of preventing a potential mass tragedy. Authorities are investigating how Cagle legally obtained the firearm, which he was not permitted to possess.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Social Media Threat to Shoot Up Terminal
